intro: Succisa pratensis var. ovalis, commonly known as the oval-leaved mouse-ear. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, characterized by its rosette of oval, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a spike, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. This variety is closely related to other members of the Boraginaceae family, sharing similar botanical features.
